Travis Bruton
=============

![T Bruton.1](https://www.glennheightstx.gov/ImageRepository/Document?documentId=2310)

Travis Bruton, Mayor Pro Tem
[Email Travis Bruton](mailto:travis.bruton@glennheightstx.gov)
(972) 223-1690. ext. 193

Travis J Bruton is a dedicated public servant, community advocate, and leader committed to making a lasting impact in Glenn Heights, Texas. Originally from Peoria, Illinois, Travis developed a passion for public service early in life. He pursued higher education at the University of Memphis, earning a Bachelor of Business Administration in Finance, and later completed his MBA in Accounting and Finance.

Since moving to Glenn Heights in 2013, Travis has been at the forefront of initiatives aimed at improving the community. In 2017, he made history as the youngest person ever elected to the Glenn Heights City Council. During his tenure, he established the Youth Advisory Council, empowering young residents to engage in local governance. He also facilitated a citywide partnership with CVS to introduce a prescription drug discount card, helping residents save significantly on medication costs.

Beyond his city council role, Travis serves on multiple boards and committees, including as Vice Chair of the National League of Cities Small Cities Council, a member of Leadership Southwest, and an advisor to the Red Oak ISD Superintendent’s Council. His advocacy efforts have secured over a million dollars in grants for Glenn Heights, furthering economic development and local resources.

Travis remains deeply committed to fostering growth, transparency, and progress in Glenn Heights. Through his leadership, he continues to build partnerships, advocate for funding, and engage residents in shaping the city’s future. You can find out more about his initiatives and impact at TravisJBruton.com
